sentences.en: And the augurs mock their own presage.
sentences.cn: 不祥的占卜把自己的预言嘲讽.

sentences.en: But it may presage a longer slowdown.
By certain signs we may presage of heats and rains.
sentences.cn: 靠某种迹象,我们可以预测酷热和下雨.

sentences.en: Conclusion: Dynamic transcutaneous bilirubinometry can presage newborn pathological jaundice.
sentences.cn: 结论: 动态经皮测新生儿胆红素能早期预测新生儿病理性黄疸,对防止病理性黄疸有一定的指导作用.

sentences.en: Despite their antiquity, their bodies were already starting to presage humanity, the scientists said.
sentences.cn: 科学家们说, 虽然很古老, 但这一前人类物种的身体已经开始显示出人类的特点.

sentences.en: Figurines presage the emergence of sculpture in greece.
sentences.cn: 雕塑预示着希腊雕刻的出现.

sentences.en: In dreams one may presage the future.
sentences.cn: 一个人能从梦中预感将来。

sentences.en: Martin's departure is therefore momentous and historic, but may also presage changes to the post, one with which the British public is largely unfamiliar.
sentences.cn: 马丁的离职重要且具历史意义，但可能也预示着这一职位会有所改变，英国公众对这个职位并不甚熟悉。

sentences.en: On past form the slowdown seemed likely to presage a long slump.
sentences.cn: 从过去的经验来看,这种下降很可能是经济大萧条的预兆.

sentences.en: The change could presage serious problems.
sentences.cn: 这变化可能预示着有严重问题将要发生.
乌云预示着暴风雨的到来.

sentences.en: The large number of moderate earthquakes that have occurred recently could presage a larger quake soon.
sentences.cn: 最近多次发生中等强度的地震，这预示着可能很快就会发生更强烈的地震。

sentences.en: The talents and virtues which were displayed in that great struggle were a sure presage of all that has since followed.
sentences.cn: 在那场伟大的斗争中所展示的天资和美德无疑已经预示了其后发生的一切。

sentences.en: This is a presage and an urge.
Those black clouds presage a storm.
sentences.cn: 那乌云预示着暴风雨将要来临.
那样的密云预示着暴风雨将要来临.

sentences.en: To indicate or give warning of beforehand; presage.
sentences.cn: 预示事先暗示或警告; 预言.

sentences.en: When the weasel and the cat make a marriage , it is a very ill presage.
sentences.cn: 黄鼠狼和猫成亲, 不是好兆头.

trans.tran_en: to be a sign that something is going to happen, especially something bad
